meaningMnemonic:
A <kanji>meat</kanji> <kanji>shop</kanji> is a place that sells meat. Who sells meat? A <vocabulary>butcher shop</vocabulary>!

肉屋 often refers to the butcher shop, but it can also mean the actual butchers who work there. You might also see this as お肉屋さん, but that won't change the meaning — it can still be either the shop or the butcher, depending on context!
readingMnemonic: For 肉 you use the にく reading (which you learned with the kanji). For 屋 you use the kun'yomi, which you learned with the kanji. Basically, if you learned the kanji readings, you can read this word!
